channel.title: Home on BiosensUM
channel.description: Recent content in Home on BiosensUM

item.title: Join BiosensUM 2019!
item.description: Each year, a new BiosensUM team representing the University of Montreal (and Canada!) at the SensUs Competition is formed. It consists of a team of students from the various schools of the University of Montreal Campus, Polytechnique, HEC and Université de Montréal. We need chemists and biochemists for the development of the test and its chemical and biological optimization. Physicists, engineers and computer scientists are also needed for the development and programming of the analytical instrument.

item.title: Our team
item.description: Marie-Pier Dinel President Marie-Pier is a master’s candidate in chemistry in the group of Prof. Jean-François Masson. She specializes in the development of medical biosensors using surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy. LinkedIn Twitter Jean-Antoine Gauthier Cyr VP Technology Jean-Antoine graduated from the University of Montreal with a Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry and is now a Chemical Engineering student at Polytechnique. LinkedIn Antoine Nkaye VP Entrepreneurship Antoine is completing a certificate leading to the CPA / CFA profession at HEC Montréal.

item.title: Sponsors
item.description: article img { margin: 16px; width: 256px; } Vice-Rector for Student Affairs and Studies Vice-Rector for International Affairs and Francophony Regional Mass Spectrometry Centre

item.title: About
item.description: BiosensUM is a multidisciplinary student team that represents Canada in the 2018 SensUs Contest. This Canadian crew is coming from the Université de Montréal and its associated schools, Polytechnique Montréal and HEC Montréal. Graduate and undergraduate students are from different academic fields such as Biochemistry, Chemistry, Engineering, Computer Science and Marketing. SensUs is the first international student competition on the development of molecular biosensors for healthcare applications. SensUs is organised by the students of Eidenhoven University of Technology, in the Netherlands, in collaboration with professors of international universities.
